sub_topic: Nuclear structure and properties of nuclei
message_1: What is the mass number and atomic number of an atom with 6 protons and 8 neutrons in its nucleus?
message_2:
The atomic number of an atom is the number of protons in its nucleus. In this case, there are 6 protons, so the atomic number is 6.

The mass number of an atom is the sum of the number of protons and neutrons in its nucleus. In this case, there are 6 protons and 8 neutrons, so the mass number is 6 + 8 = 14.

Therefore, the atom has an atomic number of 6 and a mass number of 14.
